page.title: 13MORDIFORD RECREATION cont.
page.content: The Wye Valley Walk runs through the D-Block. For entertainment people visit the Moon Inn for a drink or a game of darts. The Pub has a tourist season in the summer but most of its customers are regulars. Every year a fete is held in Mordiford (usually at Sufton Court). There are also barn dances held at Dormington. To raise money at Christmas the church choir go round carol singing & also there is a regular whist drive. The money raised is donated to the Church of England Society. At Mordiford Primary School they have a school fete & the children put on a play for the locals & parents to watch. The local discos are usually held at the school.
